description:
Sporadically  a Cinder volume is unmounted previous to beeing required for a spawning VM in tempest tests.

Example log data set at http://176.9.127.22:8081/refs-changes-66-235766-3/

For details search http://176.9.127.22:8081/refs-changes-66-235766-3/logs/screen-n-cpu.log.txt for volume name 'volume-632e0d7d-d07b-449f-87f4'
title: Sporadic Libvirt volume timing issue

comments.content:
Sporadically  a Cinder volume is unmounted previous to beeing required for a spawning VM in tempest tests.

Example log data set at http://176.9.127.22:8081/refs-changes-66-235766-3/

For details search http://176.9.127.22:8081/refs-changes-66-235766-3/logs/screen-n-cpu.log.txt for volume name 'volume-632e0d7d-d07b-449f-87f4'
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~2-silvan

comments.content: Issue did not arise for quite some time. Possibly this has changed due to work in the nova/cinder integration in the last month. Looking out for more occurrences ...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~2-silvan

comments.content:
Ouch, just hit it again:

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~2-silvan

comments.content: This bug report is seriously outdated and the logs no longer available. I'll create a new bug entry should this issue arise again.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~2-silvan

comments.content:
Change abandoned by Silvan Kaiser (<email address hidden>) on branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/264752
Reason: This patch is superseeded by a systemd-run based patch at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/432344/ as proposed.
